newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson wins 1 bln SKR Thai contract.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson wins 1 bln SKR Thai contract.

text.p: Swedish telecoms giant L M Ericsson AB said on Wednesday it had signed a contract with Thai telephone operator, the Telephone Organisation of Thailand, for AXE exchanges worth one billion crowns.
In a statement, Ericsson said the major part of the deliveries and installations would take place in 1997.
The Thai group, TOT, is a state-owned telecom company providing a national public telecommunications service in Thailand.
Ericsson spokesman Rolf Granstrom said the two companies have had an excellent relationship since TOT was formed in 1954.
TOT has plans over the next five years to more than double the number of its lines which means six million lines will be installed across the country by the year 2001.
Ericsson currently has about 900 staff in Thailand with a head office in Bangkok and production unit for AXE exchanges at Ayuthaya, north of the capital.
